channel.title: Tech Talks
channel.description: Its a collection of technical talks that I enjoyed watching. I have avoided putting product announcements or company specific talks.You can also contribute to the list by forking on github.

item.title: The Evolution of Java: Past, Present, and Future
item.description: Great talk by Joshua Bloch, creator of Java collections library, on how Java evolved over the years.

item.title: Emacs - The editor of the lifetime
item.description: Talk from a person who used emacs for last thirty years. Only few software last that long.

item.title: Simplicity Matters by Rich Hickey
item.description: Great talk on how simplicity should be a design goal rather an afterthought.

item.title: Kanban for Developers with TJ Gokcen
item.description: One nice video about technique for managing a software development process - Kanban.

item.title: Programming with nothing - Tom Stuart
item.description: Great talk on how everything in program is a function after all.

item.title: Y Not- Adventures in Functional Programming by Jim Weirich
item.description: Great talk on Lambda calculus with fascinating demo code.

item.title: The Value of Values with Rich Hickey
item.description: Great talk on how immutability is the basis of modern information systems.

item.title: User interface algorithms @JSConf by Mark DiMarco
item.description: Great talk on how math meets user interface design.

item.title: Legacy - Creating software that lasts long : Scala Days 2014
item.description: Great talk on how to build computer systems like biological systems which will evolve with time.

item.title: Design sprints - Google I/O 2014
item.description: Great talk on how to design and prototype within a week. Concrete examples from Google Ventures and Google X.
